title: "Deep analysis of the symbolic correspondences in the school of fascination"
first_phrase: In this text, the author provides an in-depth analysis of symbolic correspondences in the school of fascination, specifically focusing on the alchemical symbols. The process of understanding these symbols and their analogical reasoning paths is subtle and imperfectly described exclusively in material terms. The first five operations, metaphorical images indicating the initial states of consciousness, correspond to the first signs of the zodiac and lead to the development of particular vision and foresight abilities. The author delves into the ancient traditions and practices of the smaller and larger mysteries, leading to the re-equilibrium of an individual. In the last 200 tokens, the author discusses how the induction of magnetism was further developed from the secret alchemic practices that operated on the active and passive elements of consciousness in humans.
content: En la antigüedad los pequeños Misterios (Obra al Blanco) venían celebrados en primavera, los grandes Misterios (Obras al Rojo) en otoño. Porque se tenía un desarrollo de tales dones es necesario un reequilibrio del hombre. Este reequilibrio puede ser realizado también solo. Se dice que cuando operamos solos operamos como se dice tradicionalmente “sobre un único vaso” es decir solo sobre nosotros mismos. Pero podemos también operar sobre “dos vasos”. Las inducciones magnéticas que se difundieron hacia el fin del 1700 fueron derivadas históricamente de la vulgarización de algunos elementos de precedentes practicas secretas alquímicas que operaban sobre los dos elementos de consciencia activa ( = ) y pasiva ( = ) en el hombre.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the practice of dividing our internal consciousness into two parts, active and passive, represented by "two vessels," can help bring about a necessary rebalancing of the self. By using this technique, individuals can work alone or with a partner to achieve a more harmonious state of being. The practice of fascination through eye contact corresponds to the first five alchemical operations and can be used as a tool for personal growth and development.
